npcs.name: Kethril Brightshard
npcs.quote: If it's not made of gold, it's not worth my time.
npcs.appearance: Kethril is a stout dwarf with a bushy beard and piercing blue eyes. His armor is adorned with gold filigree.
npcs.personality: Kethril is single-minded in his pursuit of treasure and will stop at nothing to get it.
npcs.definingmoment: Kethril's obsession with treasure began when he discovered a cache of long-lost dwarven gold in a secret chamber. Since then, he has been on a never-ending quest to find more.
npcs.plothook: Kethril claims to have knowledge of a legendary hoard of gold hidden deep in the mountains, but he needs a group of adventurers to help him get to it.
npcs.secret: Kethril's true motivation for finding treasure is not just for the wealth, but to fund the rebuilding of his clan's ancestral home, which was destroyed in a goblin invasion.
npcs.personalityquirk: Kethril has a habit of spitting on his hands before handling any valuable items he finds.

items.name: The Weary Traveler's Cloak
items.description: This cloak is a dusty grey, adorned with patches and loose threads. Despite its appearance, it radiates warmth and comfort. It seems to know the burden of a weary traveler.
items.effects: The Weary Traveler's Cloak gives the wearer a sense of comfort and familiarity, allowing them to rest more easily on their travels. When worn during a long rest, the wearer gains an extra hit die and regains an additional 1d4 hit points. Additionally, once per day, the wearer can use the cloak to conjure a small campfire, providing warmth and light for up to 4 hours. The campfire disappears after 4 hours or if extinguished by the wearer.
